question: Global eradication of small pox was done on:-
exp: Eradication is a global term, which means complete extermination of organism. Globally eradicated diseases/starins of organisms are: Small pox- Last case of small pox globally is listed on: 26th October 1977 & global eradication of small pox is done on 8th May 1980. Polio virus type-2 on 20th september 2015. Polio virus type-3 on 17th Ocoyober 2019. - Disease free status (India) is given to: Polio on 27/03/2014. Trachoma on 08/12/2017.

question: Definition of surveillance:-
exp: surveillance Monitoring Constant scrutiny of factors affecting a disease with attention, authority & suspicion (Systematic ongoing collection, compilation, analysis & interpretation of data) Inbuilt action component is seen Feedback is inbuilt Cyclical continuous process Broader concept Continuous overlooking of progress of health activity [performance & analysis of routine measurements aimed at detecting changes in environment or health status of population - e.g. monitoring of air pollution, water quality, and growth & nutritional status No inbuilt action component No feedback One-time linear process Smaller concept
opc: Systemic collection and analysis of data

question: HIV sentinel surveillance provides data mainly for:
exp: HIV Sentinel surveillance: Aim- To monitor trends of HIV infection. Objectives include- Determining level of HIV infection among general population as well as high risk groups To understand trends of HIV epidemic To understand geographical spread of it Estimation of HIV prevalence & disease burden Provide information for prioritization of programme resources & evaluation of its impact
opa: To assess the quality of related services

question: Measures involved in sentinel surveillance include all of the following except:-
exp: Sentinel surveillance: It is a method for identifying the missing cases & thereby supplementing the notified cases. It is extrapolated to entire population, to estimate disease prevalence in total population. It minimizes repoing bias & simplifies feedback of information to the providers.
opa: Identifying missing cases in notification of diseases

question: Complete interruption of transmission of a disease in a geographical area , though organism is still persisting in the environment is known as:-
exp: Disease elimination is complete interruption of transmission of disease in a defined geographical area, but the causative organism may be persisting in the environment. Disease elimination is a 'geographical term' i.e. can be used only for a country / region India has eliminated 4 diseases till date: 1.Guinea worm : February 2000 2.Leprosy: December 2005 3.Yaws: July 2016 4. Maternal & Neonatal Tetanus : July 2016 Disease control --> reducing transmission of disease agent to such a low level that it ceases to be a public health problem. Disease eradication --> complete 'extermination' of organism ('tearing out by roots') World has eradicated ONLY 1 disease till date: Small pox (declared eradicated on 8 May, 1980)

question: Mass treatment is used in following diseases except:
exp: MASS TREATMENT - All people in community are administered with drugs whether they have the disease or not. - The mass treatment is used in control Yaws, Pinta, Bejel, Trachoma & Filariasis. - The existence of at least 4-5 cases of latent infection for each clinical case of active disease in the community is rationale for it. - Patients with a latent (incubating) infection may develop disease at any time. In such cases, mass treatment is a critical factor in the interruption of disease transmission.
